title: 25 Christmas Gifts ELLE Editors Are Giving This Season
Bespoke basics: would you pay £160 for this T-shirt?
description: Sunspel, the upmarket basics menswear company who put James Bond and Brad Pitt in luxury tees, have launched a bespoke service for men and womenThe T-shirt is white with a soft, almost cosy feel. It’s heavy, too. Made from mid-weight Supima brushed cotton, it has a crew neck, subtle stitching, slim elbow-length sleeves and sits slightly below the hip. It’s comfy and fits perfectly. It’s also a white T-shirt. And who in their right mind would pay £160 for something they may spill coffee down?This season, Sunspel – the upmarket basics menswear company who put James Bond, Brad Pitt and the dad in Paddington 2 in luxury tees – have launched a bespoke T-shirt service for men and women. Customers are measured and quizzed on tweaks – you can change the fabric, the stitching, arm and hip lengths. It takes about a month from start to finish, and is made by one woman in Sunspel’s Long Eaton factory. Continue reading...
author: Morwenna Ferrier

title: Primers: 10 of the best
description: Don’t write them off as just another step in your routine: primers can make a huge difference to whatever goes on topI never really thought that primers would form a significant part of my makeup ritual. For me, primers were simply another step I just didn’t have time for. And so I skipped it. To my peril. What I have long realised is that a decent primer is imperative to the (quality) finish of your makeup. It creates an even, blurring and hydrating base for everything that follows. This means, fundamentally, you avoid everything on your face sliding around before you’ve made it down the street. Putting on makeup without a primer is a bit like painting over layers of wallpaper. You think it looks OK. Then you compare it to a wall that has been skimmed, cleaned and primed before being painted. And you get an aha moment. There’s no comparing the two. However, I do understand why, aside from the time factor, tons of people don’t use primers. Historically, the textures and formulations have been a bit gunky and ironically just didn’t work well with foundations, leaving a piling effect. These days the choice is better and much more wide-ranging – textures (powders, sprays, balms) and also finishes, to meet all needs (blurring, mattifying, glowing). Which means you no longer need to worry about your primer making your face look like a bobbly old jumper.1. Refy Blur and Hydrate Primer £24, refybeauty.com 2. Dr Jart+ Pore Remedy Smoothing Primer £31, boots.com 3. Milk Make Up Hydro Grip Primer £35, sephora.co.uk 4. Shiseido Revitalessence Skin Glow Primer £39, shiseido.co.uk 5. Bobbi Brown Vitamin Enriched Face Base £40.50, bobbibrown.co.uk 6. Hourglass Vanish Airbrush Primer £55, hourglasscosmetics.co.uk 7. Tatcha Liquid Silk Canvas Primer £51, spacenk.com 8. Merit Great Skin Priming Moisturiser £40, meritbeauty.com 9. E.L.F Power Grip Primer £10, elfcosmetics.com 10. Il Makiage No Filter Poreless Base Smoothing Primer, £42, ilmakiage.com Continue reading...

title: There’s One Day Left To Get Coach Outlet Gifts Before The Holidays

Shop Well-Received, our collection of editor-approved holiday gift guides, here.Holiday shopping can be fun — and it doesn’t have to wreck your wallet. Our curated gift guides are packed with $25 stocking stuffers, under-$100 luxury finds, and crowd-pleasers on sale, making it easy to check everyone off your list without overspending. But sometimes, the best move is to keep it simple and shop in one spot. Enter Coach Outlet — your go-to for trend-forward gifts at mega discounts. Think fly accessories for your fashion-obsessed bestie or luxe little somethings for your impossible-to-shop-for mom.We combed through the retailer’s new arrivals and bestsellers to uncover the trendiest handbags, accessories, and jewelry at every gifting price point. Whether you’re splurging on someone special (maybe yourself!) or need great under-$50 picks for your Secret Santa exchange, you’ll find it here. Just don’t wait — order by December 17 to ensure your gifts arrive by December 24 (in the nick of time for Christmas and Hanukkah).Keep scrolling to shop everything from $40 Coach Outlet wallets to $240 backpacks — guaranteed to delight. DashDividers_1_500x100 Coach Outlet Gifts Under $300 Claim the title of best gift-giver this season with one of Coach Outlet’s handbags. We’re eyeing a variety of styles, from tote bags and crossbodies to shoulder bags and leather backpacks. Even better? Many styles are majorly discounted right now, so you can score luxe looks without the splurge. DashDividers_1_500x100 Coach Outlet Gifts Under $200 If you’re shopping within the $100-to-$200 range, you’ll find plenty of bags with unique, festive details, including on-trend grommets and buckles, cozy fleece accents, and bow prints for your giftee to proudly flaunt for winter and beyond. DashDividers_1_500x100 Coach Outlet Gifts Under $100 Even when sticking to an under-$100 budget, there are plenty of luxe options. Think practical wallets,  playful jewelry, and even a few mini bags and wristlets that look way more expensive than they are — perfect for making your giftee feel truly spoiled. DashDividers_1_500x100 Coach Outlet Gifts Under $50 Add these adorable accessories to your cart ASAP — they’re perfect for Christmas stocking stuffers, nightly Hanukkah surprises, White Elephant gift exchanges, or a little something for your favorite coworker. Choose from wallets, bag charms, silk scarves, and jewelry that will make anyone smile. Shop all Coach Outlet gifts Like what you see? Whether it’s a sweet pair of $18 socks, a vibrant $30 bag, or a deliciously cozy $98 fleece, we’re sure those remaining on your list will be ecstatic to unwrap any of these Free People finds. title: 14 Comfortable Work Shoes For the Office and Beyond
description: When finding the perfect pair of work shoes, style ranks high on our wish lists but, naturally, so does comfort. From the subway to the office to after-work cocktails with your friends and beyond, these are the shoes you'll practically be living in daily, so it's important to shop for a pair that'll keep you feeling comfortable, supported, and chic. Ahead, we curated a list of this season's best and most comfortable work shoes for women, from slingback heels and black flats to business-casual shoes that can meet any office's dress-code requirements. Most importantly, they all have one thing in common: they'll become your go-to everyday pair. Depending on your job or daily journey, your comfort (and commute) requirements might have different needs. If you work in a more dressed-up environment with a walking commute, opt for classic, comfortable flats that you can wear with trousers. If your workplace is more casual and you drive, you can probably get away with wearing a pair of heels to spice things up. And, of course, we also made sure to include some versatile sneakers that pair well with all clothing items - and are even favorites of our own editors. Keep reading for our complete guide to the best women's work shoes. With styles from brands like Old Navy, Rothy's, and Everlane, there's something at every price point and markdown. Find your favorites and shop this season's best comfortable work shoes for standing all day.
author: Kyley Warren

title: The 27 Best Sneakers For Women - From Adidas Sambas to Hoka Trainers
description: Being comfortable in your own shoes never goes out of style, so investing in a top-tier sneaker collection is always a smart idea. When it comes to picking out the best sneakers, we look for a few key elements: good design, quality materials, and the perfect fit - because who wants to be uncomfortable? Our editors test out so many different types of shoes to provide you with the best product recommendations, and we boast a particular expertise on sneakers (call us sneakerheads, if you will). Love some casual, everyday sneakers? We've got you covered. Prefer sportier, performance sneakers for working out? We found those, too. And of course, if you're looking for cute sneakers that you can dress up for work, we've tried our fair share. To help you find the best women's sneakers to add to your wardrobe, we enlisted our expert editors, along with a handful of celebrities we've interviewed - like Kate Hudson, Ashley Graham, and Ayesha Curry - for their masterful recommendations of the best women's sneakers for 2024. These picks cover a range of styles, so you're bound to find your perfect shoe. What to Look For in the Best Women's Sneakers Whether you want something modern and playful or sleek and classic, we've uncovered the best of the best trending this year, and we'll tell you all the reasons we love these stylish sneakers. The styles fall into a number of different design categories, including: best trendy sneakers, best sustainable sneakers, best athletic sneakers, best high-top sneakers, best white sneakers, best classic sneakers, and best sneakers for walking. At the moment, fashion forecasters predict sporty dad sneakers will continue to be big throughout 2024 - particularly styles from brands like New Balance and Reebok. In an homage to the '90s and early aughts, chunky platform sneakers are also being embraced by stylists and celebrities alike - as showcased via New York Fashion Week street style. And the newly debuted Adidas Campus 00s are primed to be the season's hottest everyday sneaker this fall, thanks to its striped flair which offers an elevated take on the cult-favorite Adidas Sambas. Our own sneaker recommendations tout brands like Nike, Converse, Puma, and more. Word of advice: your shoe closet is about to get a whole lot fuller, so make some extra room. Keep reading to shop our guide to the best sneakers for women.
author: Kyley Warren

title: In France, This Workshop Copies the World’s Great Sculptures
description: The Plaster Cast Workshop of the GrandPalaisRmn has molds of more than 6,000 artworks such as the “Venus de Milo” and Alexander the Great’s foot.
